text:
In org.apache.xindice.client.xmldb.xmlrpc.CollectionImpl 
XINDICE_SERVICE_LOCATION default value is "/xindice/". The existing 
documentation calls for "Xindice" as a name of web app (and that's how I had 
it). This will brake on UNIX systems, because URL is case sensitive.

Solution:
Change the default to "/Xindice/"

/* path to XML-RPC service on database */
    private static String XINDICE_SERVICE_LOCATION = "/Xindice/";
creator: bob.stone@hp.com

text:
The webapp location was made lower cases to avoid case problems. I'll update the
docs to reflect that the URL is "/xindice/"
creator: kevin@rocketred.com.au

text:
Just to let you know, guys. This insignificant little change causes our 
development effort some major headache. We have pretty complex setup with 
Xindice as a back end and custom JMS driver that issues various messages on 
Xindice updates. There are many configuration settings that we now have to 
change to reflect this latest lowercase initiative. What's the point? This 
little change will mean big trouble for many existing users and will make 
future migration more difficult.
So I think, may be, at least for the time being /Xindice can be case 
insensitive? By lowercasing it, for example.
creator: bob.stone@hp.com

text: Now I'm a little confused. It has been lowercased to avoid case sensitivity issues.
creator: kevin@rocketred.com.au

text:
I understand the intent. But I already have it in uppercase, so after updating 
the tree with latest from CVS, my existing settings (/Xindice) are causing all 
kinds of problems, forcing me to change a lot of configuration settings. One 
possible solution is to force the incoming URL (or at least part of it) to 
lowercase
creator: bob.stone@hp.com

text:
In this case you have a couple of options already available to you. One is to
set the service location property when creating the database instance and set it
to "/Xindice". The other (which maybe simpler in your case) is to create a
servlet filter that forwards "/Xindice" to "/xindice".

I'm sorry this change has had usch and effect on your deployment. I don't think
we should make the duel mapping a default feature though. The problem arose due
to changes as 1.1 has evolved.
creator: kevin@rocketred.com.au
